12.text: Great creativity. In times of need, we need great creativity.

17.text: Discuss. Great creativity is astonishingly, absurdly, rationally, irrationally powerful.

25.text: Great creativity can spread tolerance, champion freedom,

29.text: make education seem like a bright idea.

33.text: Great creativity can turn a spotlight on deprivation,

37.text: or show that deprivation ain't necessarily so.

41.text: Great creativity can make politicians electable,

47.text: It can make war seem like tragedy or farce.

51.text: Creativity is the meme-maker that puts slogans on our t-shirts

57.text: It's the pathfinder that shows us a simple road

62.text: Science is clever, but great creativity is something less knowable,

67.text: more magical. And now we need that magic.

70.text: This is a time of need.

72.text: Our climate is changing quickly, too quickly.

74.text: And great creativity is needed to do what it does so well:

77.text: to provoke us to think differently with dramatic creative statements.

81.text: To tempt us to act differently

86.text: Here is one such scrap from an initiative I'm involved in

89.text: using creativity to inspire people to be greener.

92.text: (Video) Man: You know, rather than drive today, I'm going to walk.

96.text: Narrator: And so he walked, and as he walked he saw things.

100.text: Strange and wonderful things he would not otherwise have seen.

104.text: A deer with an itchy leg. A flying motorcycle.

107.text: A father and daughter separated from a bicycle by a mysterious wall.

112.text: And then he stopped. Walking in front of him was her.

117.text: The woman who as a child had skipped with him through fields

121.text: Sure, she had aged a little.

123.text: In fact, she had aged a lot.

124.text: But he felt all his old passion for her return.

127.text: "Ford," he called softly. For that was her name.

131.text: "Don't say another word, Gusty," she said,

134.text: "I know a tent next to a caravan, exactly 300 yards from here.

139.text: Let's go there and make love. In the tent."

142.text: Ford undressed. She spread one leg, and then the other.

146.text: Gusty entered her boldly and made love to her rhythmically

150.text: while she filmed him, because she was a keen amateur pornographer.

153.text: The earth moved for both of them.

155.text: And they lived together happily ever after.

158.text: And all because he decided to walk that day.

174.text: Andy Hobsbawm: We've got the science, we've had the debate.

177.text: The moral imperative is on the table.

179.text: Great creativity is needed to take it all,

183.text: To make it connect. To make it make people want to act.

187.text: So this is a call, a plea,

189.text: to the incredibly talented TED community.

191.text: Let's get creative against climate change.

193.text: And let's do it soon. Thank you.
